definition: lit. progenitor of the Yuan Dynasty (1279-1368), title of Khubilai Khan (1215-1294), first Yuan dynasty emperor, reigned 1260-1294
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
surname Shi

sentences.english: Khan led his army to cross exposure and raft through the Jinsha River, unified Yunnan.
sentences.chinese: 元世祖率大军跨革囊及筏渡过金沙江，统一了云南。

sentences.english: At that time, China was RULED BY THE Yuan Dynasty Emperor, Kublai Khan.
sentences.chinese: 当时元世祖忽必烈汗正统治着中国。

sentences.english: Date of birth unknown, died Yuanshizhu Emperor Yuan 20 years.
sentences.chinese: 生年不详，卒于元世祖至元二十六年。

sentences.english: Yuan of the Mongols. Genghis Khan and Kublai Khan.
sentences.chinese: 当时元世祖忽必烈汗正统治着中国。

definition: Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
Ming Taizu, Temple name of first Ming emperor Hongwu 洪武[Hong2 wu3]
Ming Chengzu, Temple name of third Ming Emperor Yongle 永樂|永乐[Yong3 le4]
Khubilai Khan (1215-1294), grandson of Genghis Khan 成吉思汗, first Yuan dynasty emperor, reigned 1260-1294
Emperor Ningzong of Southern Song (1168-1224)
Ögedei Khan (1186-1242), a son of Genghis Khan
Jin Dynasty (1115-1234), founded by the Jurchen 女真[Nu:3 zhen1] people of North China, a precursor of the Mongol Yuan Dynasty
Hongwu Emperor, also written Hung-wu Ti, reign name of first Ming emperor Zhu Yuanzhang 朱元璋[Zhu1 Yuan2 zhang1] (1328-1398), reigned 1386-1398, Temple name 明太祖[Ming2 Tai4 zu3]

posthumous title of Genghis Khan 成吉思汗[Cheng2 ji2 si1 han2] (1162-1227)
Gaozong Emperor, Temple name of the tenth Song Emperor Zhao Gou 趙構|赵构[Zhao4 Gou4] (1107-1187 AD), reigned (1127-1162 AD)
the Southern Song dynasty (1127-1279)

Yelü Chucai (1190-1244), Khitan statesman and advisor to Genghis Khan and Ögödei Khan, known for convincing the Mongols to tax the conquered population of the north China plains rather than slaughter it
to hand down an imperial edict
Emperor Xuanzong of Tang (810-859), reign name of seventeenth Tang emperor Li Chen 李忱[Li3 Chen2], reigned 846-859
